message.content:
{"id": "120922", 
"title": "Bug 120922: \"Dirty Page\" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement", 
"description": "Bug 120922: \"Dirty Page\" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes? Yes would save the changes, No would discard the changes, and Cancel would do nothing and remain on the Source page. In addition, the dialog is titled \"Error\". ", 
"OB": "The behavior of the XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. When the source is not saved and the user tries to switch to other pages, a \"Dirty Page\" prompt should be displayed, giving the options to save or discard the changes. The dialog should not include quotes and should have a more appropriate title instead of \"Error\".", 
"EB": "A better approach would be to display a \"Dirty Page\" prompt when the source is not saved and the user tries to switch to other pages. The prompt should provide clear options to save or discard the changes. The dialog should be titled appropriately and should not include quotes.", 
"SR": "If you edit the XML in the \"source\" view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, an error message saying \"Source page is dirty\" is displayed. This error message does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes." }

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '120922', 'title': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved', 'description': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved." (including the quotes). And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?<Yes <No <CancelYes would save the changesNo would discard the changesCancel would do nothing and remain on the Source pageIn addition, the dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes). ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'A better and more typical approach would be:XML Report Design has been changed. The dialog needs to use a better title (and certainly should not have the quotes). ', 'SR': 'If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes.This problem is the user has to figure out what he needs to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very good.The error message is "Source page is dirty. '}
